trans-unit.source: Manage access control records in StorSimple | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Manage access control records in StorSimple | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Describes how to use access control records (ACRs) to determine which hosts can connect to a volume on the StorSimple device.
trans-unit.target: Describes how to use access control records (ACRs) to determine which hosts can connect to a volume on the StorSimple device.

trans-unit.source: Use the StorSimple Manager service to manage access control records
trans-unit.target: Use the StorSimple Manager service to manage access control records

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: Access control records (ACRs) allow you to specify which hosts can connect to a volume on the StorSimple device.
trans-unit.target: Access control records (ACRs) allow you to specify which hosts can connect to a volume on the StorSimple device.

trans-unit.source: ACRs are set to a specific volume and contain the iSCSI Qualified Names (IQNs) of the hosts.
trans-unit.target: ACRs are set to a specific volume and contain the iSCSI Qualified Names (IQNs) of the hosts.

trans-unit.source: When a host tries to connect to a volume, the device checks the ACR associated with that volume for the IQN name and if there is a match, then the connection is established.
trans-unit.target: When a host tries to connect to a volume, the device checks the ACR associated with that volume for the IQN name and if there is a match, then the connection is established.

trans-unit.source: The access control records section on the **Configure** page displays all the access control records with the corresponding IQNs of the hosts.
trans-unit.target: The access control records section on the **Configure** page displays all the access control records with the corresponding IQNs of the hosts.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial explains the following common ACR-related tasks:
trans-unit.target: This tutorial explains the following common ACR-related tasks:

trans-unit.source: Add an access control record
trans-unit.target: Add an access control record

trans-unit.source: Edit an access control record
trans-unit.target: Edit an access control record

trans-unit.source: Delete an access control record
trans-unit.target: Delete an access control record

trans-unit.source: When assigning an ACR to a volume, take care that the volume is not concurrently accessed by more than one non-clustered host because this could corrupt the volume.
trans-unit.target: When assigning an ACR to a volume, take care that the volume is not concurrently accessed by more than one non-clustered host because this could corrupt the volume.

trans-unit.source: When deleting an ACR from a volume, make sure that the corresponding host is not accessing the volume because the deletion could result in a read-write disruption.
trans-unit.target: When deleting an ACR from a volume, make sure that the corresponding host is not accessing the volume because the deletion could result in a read-write disruption.

trans-unit.source: Add an access control record
trans-unit.target: Add an access control record

trans-unit.source: You use the StorSimple Manager service **Configure** page to add ACRs.
trans-unit.target: You use the StorSimple Manager service **Configure** page to add ACRs.

trans-unit.source: Typically, you will associate one ACR with one volume.
trans-unit.target: Typically, you will associate one ACR with one volume.

trans-unit.source: Perform the following steps to add an ACR.
trans-unit.target: Perform the following steps to add an ACR.

trans-unit.source: To add an access control record
trans-unit.target: To add an access control record

trans-unit.source: On the service landing page, select your service, double-click the service name, and then click the **Configure** tab.
trans-unit.target: On the service landing page, select your service, double-click the service name, and then click the **Configure** tab.

trans-unit.source: In the tabular listing under **Access control records**, supply a **Name** for your ACR.
trans-unit.target: In the tabular listing under **Access control records**, supply a **Name** for your ACR.

trans-unit.source: Provide the IQN name of your Windows host under **iSCSI Initiator Name**.
trans-unit.target: Provide the IQN name of your Windows host under **iSCSI Initiator Name**.

trans-unit.source: To get the IQN of your Windows Server host, do the following:
trans-unit.target: To get the IQN of your Windows Server host, do the following:

trans-unit.source: Start the Microsoft iSCSI initiator on your Windows host.
trans-unit.target: Start the Microsoft iSCSI initiator on your Windows host.

trans-unit.source: In the iSCSI Initiator Properties window, on the Configuration tab, select and copy the string from the Initiator Name field.
trans-unit.target: In the iSCSI Initiator Properties window, on the Configuration tab, select and copy the string from the Initiator Name field.

trans-unit.source: Paste this string in the **iSCSI Initiator Name** field on the ACRs table in the Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: Paste this string in the **iSCSI Initiator Name** field on the ACRs table in the Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: Click **Save** to save the newly created ACR.
trans-unit.target: Click **Save** to save the newly created ACR.

trans-unit.source: The tabular listing will be updated to reflect this addition.
trans-unit.target: The tabular listing will be updated to reflect this addition.

trans-unit.source: Edit an access control record
trans-unit.target: Edit an access control record

trans-unit.source: You use the **Configure** page in the Management Portal to edit ACRs.
trans-unit.target: You use the **Configure** page in the Management Portal to edit ACRs.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] You can modify only those ACRs that are currently not in use.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] You can modify only those ACRs that are currently not in use.

trans-unit.source: To edit an ACR associated with a volume that is currently in use, you must first take the volume offline.
trans-unit.target: To edit an ACR associated with a volume that is currently in use, you must first take the volume offline.

trans-unit.source: Perform the following steps to edit an ACR.
trans-unit.target: Perform the following steps to edit an ACR.

trans-unit.source: To edit an access control record
trans-unit.target: To edit an access control record

trans-unit.source: On the service landing page, select your service, double-click the service name, and then click the **Configure** tab.
trans-unit.target: On the service landing page, select your service, double-click the service name, and then click the **Configure** tab.

trans-unit.source: In the tabular listing of the access control records, hover over the ACR that you wish to modify.
trans-unit.target: In the tabular listing of the access control records, hover over the ACR that you wish to modify.

trans-unit.source: Supply a new name and/or IQN for the ACR.
trans-unit.target: Supply a new name and/or IQN for the ACR.

trans-unit.source: Click **Save** to save the modified ACR.
trans-unit.target: Click **Save** to save the modified ACR.

trans-unit.source: The tabular listing will be updated to reflect this change.
trans-unit.target: The tabular listing will be updated to reflect this change.

trans-unit.source: Delete an access control record
trans-unit.target: Delete an access control record

trans-unit.source: You use the **Configure** page in the Management Portal to delete ACRs.
trans-unit.target: You use the **Configure** page in the Management Portal to delete ACRs.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] You can delete only those ACRs that are currently not in use.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] You can delete only those ACRs that are currently not in use.

trans-unit.source: To delete an ACR associated with a volume that is currently in use, you must first take the volume offline.
trans-unit.target: To delete an ACR associated with a volume that is currently in use, you must first take the volume offline.

trans-unit.source: Perform the following steps to delete an access control record.
trans-unit.target: Perform the following steps to delete an access control record.

trans-unit.source: To delete an access control record
trans-unit.target: To delete an access control record

trans-unit.source: On the service landing page, select your service, double-click the service name, and then click the **Configure** tab.
trans-unit.target: On the service landing page, select your service, double-click the service name, and then click the **Configure** tab.

trans-unit.source: In the tabular listing of the access control records (ACRs), hover over the ACR that you wish to delete.
trans-unit.target: In the tabular listing of the access control records (ACRs), hover over the ACR that you wish to delete.

trans-unit.source: A delete icon (**x**) will appear in the extreme right column for the ACR that you select.
trans-unit.target: A delete icon (**x**) will appear in the extreme right column for the ACR that you select.

trans-unit.source: Click the **x** icon to delete the ACR.
trans-unit.target: Click the **x** icon to delete the ACR.

trans-unit.source: When prompted for confirmation, click **YES** to continue with the deletion.
trans-unit.target: When prompted for confirmation, click **YES** to continue with the deletion.

trans-unit.source: The tabular listing will be updated to reflect the deletion.
trans-unit.target: The tabular listing will be updated to reflect the deletion.

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: Read more about [managing StorSimple volumes](storsimple-manage-volumes.md).
trans-unit.target: Read more about [managing StorSimple volumes](storsimple-manage-volumes.md).
